titleStmt.title: SII 14.204: original edition by A. S. Ramanatha Ayyar
No. 204. (A.R. No. 27 of 1909.) KUṈṈAKKUḌI, TIRUPPATTUR TALUK, RAMANATHAPURAM DISTRICT. ON A PILLAR ON THE ROCK-CUT CAVE ON THE HILL.

summary.p: This record dated in the 4th year of Jaṭāvarmaṉ Śrīvallabhadēva is much damaged at the end. Its contents cannot, therefore, be correctly ascertained. It appears to register a gift made by Veḷḷāṉai-Viṭaṅkaṉ Avaiyañjāṉ, the chief of Adaḷaiyūr in Kēraḻaśiṅga-vaḷanāḍu, of certain taxes due from Mēṟkaṇṇamaṅgalam in favour of the temple of Śrīmūlasthānam-uḍaiya-Nāyaṉār on the hill called Tirumalai in Adaḷaiyūr-nāḍu.

revisionDesc.change: Further conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)
Conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)

div.p:
svastiśrī . tirumaṭantaiyu
ñ jayamaṭantaiyun ti
ruppuyaṅkaḷi linitiruppa I
ru nilamum perumai yey
ti yeṇṭicaiyuṅ kuṭai
niḻaṟṟa maṉnavarkaḷ vantiṟai
ñca varumarapil maṇimuṭi cū
ṭit teṉkumariyum vaṭa
kaṅkaiyun tiraikkaṭale
yellaiyākap pārmuḻu
tuṅ kayalāṇai parantu ce
ṅkoluṭaṉ vaḷara vira
siṅhāsaṉattu Ulakamu
ḻutuṭaiyāḷuṭaṉ viṟṟirunta
ruḷiya māmutal matikkulam
viḷakkiya komutaṟ kocca
ṭaiyapanmarāṉa tribhuvanaca
kravattikaḷ śrīvallavadeva
ṟku yāṇṭu 4Āvatu keraḷaciṅ
kavaḷanāṭṭu Ataḷaiyūr nāṭṭut
teṉāṟṟup pokku tirumalaiyi
l śrīmulastānamuṭaiya nāya
ṉārkku Iṉṉāṭṭu Ataḷaiyūr nāṭā
ḻvāṉ veḷḷāṉai viṭaṅkaṉ A
vaiyañcāṉneṉ meṟkaṇṇa
maṅkalattu Eṉṉoparatiyāl va
nta Iṟai kuṭimai vantaThe lines after this containing boundaries of the land are very much damaged as the letters appear to have been chiselled out. The following can be read— viṭaṅkaṉ avaiyañcānen mel kaṇṇamaṅkalattu ellai••••mel ellai••••ellaikku kiḻakkum •••• lai tuḻāyūr••••tirukkuṉṟakkuṭi ellaikku mekkum vaṭa ellai kuṟumpūtakāṭṭu ellaikku tekkum noccikuḷattu ellaikku tekkum innānkellaikkuḷ pātiyum nīr vāttu kalli••••ni damaṅed After this
Digital edition of SII 14.204 by converted to DHARMA conventions by Emmanuel Francis.
